description: Basis of record, as defined in our BasisOfRecord enum

An identifier of any form assigned by the source within a physical collection or digital dataset for the record which may not be unique, but should be fairly unique in combination with the institution and collection code.
Class classification key.
An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the physical collection or digital dataset uniquely within the context of an institution.
Continent, as defined in our Continent enum
The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Supports range queries.
The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the country in which the occurrence was recorded.
Crawl attempt that harvested this record.
The ID of the dataset.
The occurrence dataset key (a uuid).
The name of the dataset.
Latitude in decimals between -90 and 90 based on WGS 84. Supports range queries.
Longitude in decimals between -180 and 180 based on WGS 84. Supports range queries.
Depth in meters relative to altitude. For example 10 meters below a lake surface with given altitude. Supports range queries.
Elevation (altitude) in meters above sea level. Supports range queries.
EstablishmentMeans, as defined in our EstablishmentMeans enum
Occurrence date in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM, yyyy-MM-dd, or MM-dd. Supports range queries.
An identifier for the information associated with a sampling event.
Family classification key.
Start partial date of a date range, accepts the format yyyy-MM, for example: 2015-11
A GADM geographic identifier at any level, for example AGO, AGO.1_1, AGO.1.1_1 or AGO.1.1.1_1
A GADM  region level, valid values range from 0 to 3
A GADM geographic identifier at the zero level, for example AGO
A GADM geographic identifier at the first level, for example AGO.1_1
A GADM geographic identifier at the second level, for example AFG.1.1_1
A GADM geographic identifier at the third level, for example AFG.1.1.1_1
Genus classification key.

Filters to match occurrence records with coordinate values within a specified distance of a coordinate, it supports units: in (inch), yd (yards), ft (feet), km (kilometers), mmi (nautical miles), mm (millimeters), cm centimeters, mi (miles), m (meters), for example /occurrence/search?geoDistance=90,100,5km

Limits searches to occurrence records which contain a value in both latitude and longitude (i.e. hasCoordinate=true limits to occurrence records with coordinate values and hasCoordinate=false limits to occurrence records without coordinate values).

Includes/excludes occurrence records which contain spatial issues (as determined in our record interpretation), i.e. hasGeospatialIssue=true returns only those records with spatial issues while hasGeospatialIssue=false includes only records without spatial issues. The absence of this parameter returns any record with or without spatial issues.
The person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.
Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who provided the taxonomic identification of the occurrence.
An identifier of any form assigned by the source to identify the institution the record belongs to. Not guaranteed to be unique.
A specific interpretation issue as defined in our OccurrenceIssue enum
Kingdom classification key.

This date the record was last modified in GBIF, in ISO 8601 format: yyyy, yyyy-MM, yyyy-MM-dd, or MM-dd. Supports range queries.  Note that this is the date the record was last changed in GBIF, not necessarily the date the record was first/last changed by the publisher.  Data is re-interpreted when we change the taxonomic backbone, geographic data sources, or interpretation processes.
The type license applied to the dataset or record.
The maximum number of results to return. This can't be greater than 300, any value greater is set to 300.
The specific description of the place.
The kind of multimedia associated with an occurrence as defined in our MediaType enum
The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed, according to the publisher
The month of the year, starting with 1 for January. Supports range queries.
The GBIF Network to which the occurrence belongs.
A single globally unique identifier for the occurrence record as provided by the publisher.
Either 'ABSENT' or 'PRESENT'; the presence or absence of the occurrence.
Order classification key.
An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.
A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.
The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.
Previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers.
Phylum classification key.
Preparation or preservation method for a specimen.
A group of activities, often associated with a specific funding stream, such as the GBIF BID programme.
The identifier for a project, which is often assigned by a funded programme.
Protocol or mechanism used to provide the occurrence record.
The 2-letter country code (as per ISO-3166-1) of the owining organization's country.
The publishing organization key (a uuid).
The publishing organization key (a uuid).
The person who recorded the occurrence.
Identifier (e.g. ORCID) for the person who recorded the occurrence.
An identifier given to the record at the time it was recorded in the field.
The relative measurement of the quantity of the organism (i.e. without absolute units).
Searches for records whose publishing country is different to the country where the record was recorded in.
The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.
A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.
The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during a sampling event

A scientific name from the GBIF backbone. All included and synonym taxa are included in the search. Under the hood a call to the species match service is done first to retrieve a taxonKey. Only unique scientific names will return results, homonyms (many monomials) return nothing! Consider to use the taxonKey parameter instead and the species match service directly
Species classification key.
he name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.
Subgenus classification key.

A taxon key from the GBIF backbone. All included and synonym taxa are included in the search, so a search for aves with taxonKey=212 (i.e. /occurrence/search?taxonKey=212) will match all birds, no matter which species.
End partial date of a date range, accepts the format yyyy-MM, for example: 2019-12
Nomenclatural type (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
Country country of the user who made the requested
The scientific name provided to GBIF by the data publisher, before interpretation and processing by GBIF.
The taxon identifier provided to GBIF by the data publisher.
The name of the water body in which the Locations occurs.
The 4 digit year. A year of 98 will be interpreted as AD 98. Supports range queries.
